member.name: T:Prime31.WinPhoneAds.WinPhoneAd
member.summary:
Note: the plugin post build system will attempt to do all of the following setup for you. If for some reason it fails, below are the manual steps required.
After building your Visual Studio project you will need to add a reference to the Microsoft Ads SDK. You can follow the guide here (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/advertising-mobile-windows-phone-8-adcontrol-walkthrough-api(v=msads.20).aspx) or do the following:
- right click and choose Add Reference + select Windows Phone -> Extensions in the left pane + check the box next to Microsoft Advertising SDK for Windows Phone 8 (XAML) - open the WMAppManifest.xml file and in the Capabilities tab check: ID_CAP_IDENTITY_USER, ID_CAP_MEDIALIB_PHOTO, ID_CAP_PHONEDIALER and ID_CAP_WEBBROWSERCOMPONENT

member.name: M:Prime31.WinPhoneAds.WinPhoneAd.createAdControl(Prime31.WinPhoneAds.WinPhoneAdConfig)
member.summary: Creates an ad from the data provided in the adConfig object. Note that Microsoft recommends using an ad size of 480 x 80 even if the ad you setup in pub Center is 320 x 50.

member.name: M:Prime31.WinPhoneAds.WinPhoneAd.refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the ad as long as there is only one present

member.name: M:Prime31.WinPhoneAds.WinPhoneAd.removeAd
member.summary: Removes the ad as long as there is only one present
